alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Clay (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 26 at 3:59AM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest North Carolina, including the following areas, Cherokee and Clay. Portions of east Tennessee, including the following areas, Blount Smoky Mountains, Cocke Smoky Mountains, East Polk, Sevier Smoky Mountains and Southeast Monroe. * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms may produce heavy rain at times today through Friday morning. Storms that track repeatedly over the same areas may produce flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
